text:
We went to lunch at this shop along Toh Yi ( Jalan Jurong Kechil ) and the owner Martin is very friendly and both him and I forgot to ask the name of the lovely lady attending to us, were very welcoming.

We ordered meals for 5 pax and some sides, drinks,  along with two different types of beer from the tap and the bill was $95.

Didn’t take photo of the chicken chop but mum-iL said it was good, photos below of  spicy ramyeon, a BLT, fish & chips, spam fries & chili crab Mantou.

Edinger and Guinness from the tap, pink guava & canned drinks. My 89 y o mom-nlaw would have liked a root beer float but saw it too late. And Martin noticed her food was last to arrive and she had finished her pick guava, he kindly topped up her glass so nice if him.

We will be visiting again as we didn’t get to try all the food and there were so many yummy looking things on their menu.

Had the Angus beef pie ($10), was surprised by the small size. But at least it came with a small side of fries. The cappuccino ($5) is not bad, I think the used the beans from Lavazza.

They have a wide ranging choice of food, I think I saw spaghetti, sandwiches etc. They also have all day happy hour for beer and stout.
Place is nice and cozy. Staff is friendly. Coffee is priced reasonable. Love the chicken chop portion is big, come with bread, baked beans and fries.

Already had lunch when I happened on this newly opened cafe. So just had the beef pie... allegedly Angus beef.

I felt beef pie was terrible - portion was about size of a small size girl's palm; crust tasted hard as cardboard and taste-wise as well. Only consolation was the fries which were crispy on outside n soft on inside.

But I decided to give them another chance since this was not their main dish and it's not easy to survive in food industry so shouldn't kill someone's dream so quickly.

Plus point also for their self-served lemon-infused chilled water.

Prices for coffee not competitive but maybe there is a reason for that...will know when next I try them.

Really happy to see a new cafe open in this area as we were getting bored of the ones around. The menu is unique that it includes a fusion of local food or if you want simple toast and coffee. Most importantly it’s child friendly - high chairs and kids utensil provided and the staff are friendly and passionate about what they do. They have alcohol for parents which is a bonus! Definitely recommend this place for a weekend dine out with your kids.
